result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. Jackson

defendant.name: Jackson, Jesse J.

records.addlTxt: 10:57 AM Defendant Jesse J. Jackson in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Defendant Jesse J. Jackson in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Katte confirms receipt of previously filed Motion to Revoke and stipulates to the motion.  Court will grant motion to revoke DEJ.  ADA Niemi makes recommendation on the record.  Attorney Katte speaks to jail credit regarding all cases.  Court speaks.  Defendant requests that some of the jail time able to be served in inpatient treatment.  Court orders:  30 days VCJ on each count to run consecutive with 15CM323 with 82 days credit noted:  TIME SERVED.  Fined $443.00 to be paid at a rate of $50/mo to commence 9/1/19.  Court indicates that if defendant is still confined at this time, it is his responsibility to request an extension.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse J. Jackson
Current: PO Box 251, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538 United States  (Effective: 01-21-2019)
Prior: 311 Cree Street PO Box 251, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538
Status hearing on January 25, 2019 at 11:00 am.

Defendant appears in court, in custody.  Attorney Jolin appears specially for Attorney Katte.  ADA Niemi appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases to track with 19CF07.  Status hearing set 1/25/2019 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jesse J. Jackson in court, in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft indicates that he has attempted to contact the public defender's office multiple times without success.  Case set aside for Attorney Jolin to meet with deft to see if he qualifies.
11:04 am  Back on the record.  Attorney Jolin now appears specially.  Defendant qualifies for public defender representation, but she has a conflict and will be seeing if Attorney Katte would be willing/able to take case as she previously represented the deft.  Status hearing scheduled for January 16, 2019 at 01:00 pm.

Defenant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail, without attorney.  ADA Niemi appears for the State of Wisconsin.  $500 Cash bond set.  Set for status hearing on January 14, 2019 at 10:00 am.  Bond form.

Attorney Anne M. Katte in court.  Martha Johanna Milanowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft does not appear.  Atty Katte indicates that she is unaware of client's whereabouts.  Bench warrant authorized:  $1,000 cash total ($500.00 on each case).

****THIS IS APPLIED TO BOTH CASES 15cm308 & 15cm323
18-11356

ADA Breedlove appears in Court for State.  Defendant appears by video in Vilas County Jail, without counsel.  This matter is brought to the court for Failure to appear on both cases 15CM308 & 15CM323.  State gives Court Notice of Motion & Motion to Revoke Deferre Entry of Judgment Agreement & Order.  Court suggest Defendant to call Public defenders office.  Court sets for hearing on Revoke of DEJ  November 15, 2018 at 8:30 am.  Court issues Signature bond for $1000.00.

Motion to modify cash bond to signature bond: Granted. $2500.00 signature bond with conditions: 1) Not to possess or consume intoxicants  2) Follow through with any after care recommendations following completion of in-patient treatment  3) Provide certificate of completion to DA's office.

In Lac du Flambeau. Deft not present. Atty Katte appearing in person. ADA Breedlove present for State. Bench warrant authorized - $500.00 cash bond.
